definition: frank and outspoken (idiom)/straight speaking/to say what one thinks
straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: It shows them you aren’t afraid of saying what you feel like saying and it shows that you are confident.
sentences.chinese: 那样你会表现出心直口快和自信的魅力。

sentences.english: I am an honest man, straight as an arrow.
sentences.chinese: 我是个老实人，心直口快。

sentences.english: I was an honest man , straight as an arrow.
sentences.chinese: 我是一个诚实的人，心直口快。

sentences.english: On the outside, I was an honest man, straight as an arrow.
sentences.chinese: 在外面的时候，我是个老实人，心直口快。

definition: to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
going directly (without detour)/(fig.) direct/straightforward (in one's manner or speech)
open and candid (idiom); not hiding anything/ingenuous
to make a clear difference between what one likes and what one hates/to have well-defined likes and dislikes
